alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued October 23 at 2:36PM CDT until October 23 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Rooks County in north central Kansas... Smith County in north central Kansas... Osborne County in north central Kansas... Southeastern Phillips County in north central Kansas... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 233 PM CDT, a significant dust plume extended from near Plainville to Woodston, or 28 miles southeast of Phillipsburg, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility in blowing dust with strong wind gusts in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported near zero visibiity at times east of Stockton in Rooks County. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Plainville, Smith Center, Osborne, Stockton, Downs, Kensington, Natoma, Lebanon, Kirwin, Woodston, Gaylord, Alton, Portis, Zurich, Athol, Harlan, Cedar, Codell and Bellaire. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
